intro: Hieracium pseudobifidum subsp. zljebense, commonly known as the Zljeben hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous ray florets that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes protected species in certain regions.
